utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We all did, Juan. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But you didn't read it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know. I'm tired of people telling me that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But wait a minute, wait a minute. You got to slam me better than that. You just give into Jesse? Hey, wait a minute. OK. But anyway, the idea is that if you read the Mueller report he makes the case that this guy obstructed justice. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- the president or charge him with a crime while he is in office, these are the crimes that we found. Here's the evidence to back it up. He didn't do any of those things. utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Come on. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: OK. utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- to the Republican convention saying lock her up, lock her up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, first, the Democrats spy on Trump and then they want to throw him behind bars when he leaves office.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I mean, I don't understand where these Democrats are coming from who want this job. They want to make it -- they want it super easy to remove the president, yet they want to be president and, therefore, they are leaving a trail for how they can be easily removed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But the Republicans will never do anything like that.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So, you know, and a lot of people are --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know they won't.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: -- a lot of people are saying this. It's like Biden is the frontrunner now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And then right after Biden it's Bernie, Elizabeth Warren, and Mayor Pete. And then Kamala is a few percentage points after them. And they are saying Kamala, you know, she will be a natural V.P. choice. I think with some of her comments she is actually running for A.A. That's what it sounds like.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And you know, that's -- she is definitely --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If she is not V.P. she could be A.G. I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can I just bring in some breaking news? I mean, because there is a reality in terms of what's going on. We had Donald Trump, Jr. back before Senate intelligence, right, for several hours. And now we hear that Hope Hicks, whose communications director at Fox --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's fine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- that she is going to testify.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you still with the witch-hunt?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm with the witch hunt.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: But, Juan --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you still on the collusion thing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: If we weren't left in this expanded gray area which is what the Mueller report gave us. And I really do wish that he would have picked a side. And I wish he would have pressed the issue.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICHZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And if the president had done something so bad that was chargeable, if it were a civilian, then he should have put that in there. And he also he should have tried to charge him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Imagine how I feel, Kennedy? I agree with you, Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, even Bill Barr said when he found out they weren't going to charge he said, are you kidding me? What are you doing here?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Animals are great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Hard core partisan hack Rachel Maddow tapped to moderate an upcoming 2020 Democrat debate. Greg breaks it down next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, while the media spent Tuesdays finding new ways to say how Biden will eviscerate Trump or they miss actual news. The host of the first debate include Rachel Maddow. On the bright side it could have been John Brennan and Joy Behar. Instead, we get the duchess of smirk. Talking about taking the moderate out of the moderator. Rachel is to the left of Marx, and I don't mean the brothers or Richard. Now she is totally capable but she is also totally biased. Her livelihood depends on it. And after she spent two years talking a fantasy that painted the president as a Russian stooge. Do you think the Dems would think twice about letting her near the stage? In case you forgot, here's some of her best work.

utterances.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: This guy Kilimnik keeps turning up again and again. Konstantin Kilimnik, Konstantin Kilimnik, and Konstantin Kilimnik. Konstantin Kilimnik he is still Russian military intelligence. Kilimnik, a short man who goes by "Kostya" -- this guy Konstantin Kilimnik. Aluminum smelters, this is sleeping at his smelters. Sabotage in his smelters came to his smelters. Alex van der Zwaan? Alex van der Zwaan. Alex van der Zwaan chromium number 24. Chromium plant in Kazakhstan. Chromium plant in Kazakhstan. Next time you see something chrome plated take a deep breath, cough it out and think of the Trump Soho. Big story, tick, tick, tick, boom. Started ticking again, tick, tick, tick, tick. Four hours later. Boom, boom. You are stressing me out. He starts tick, tick, ticking again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now the obvious point is, what if Fox News had pulled this stunt and picked a highly opinionated moderator. Sadly, Diamond and Silk were busy. But we assumed our media pals would get wind of it but strange that's not the case here. It's odd how little a ripple this made in the media pond. Instead they just push absurd hallucinations.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A lot of people are talking about now is that, if he loses, Trump, he won't go. I absolutely think he will not leave.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How deranged do you have to be not just to believe that but to actually say it out loud. The derangement blinds you so much that you forget it's your side trying to undo an election. It's not Trump resisting the vote of the voters but the left concocting ways to seize power that doesn't require elections. But I get it. It's been a rough two years for the media. The country is doing great and that's bad if your industry is built on bad news. The only thing they have going for them an active imagination. Too bad the public has learned to ignore it. All right, Katie, it's a -- they knew they could make this brazen choice because they knew no one would call him on it, right?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, the idea that they will pick Rachel Maddow but won't do a Fox News debate with moderators who are in the news business really is astounding to me. Rachel Maddow is basically a conspiracy theorist if we look back at all the Russia coverage that she did that she claimed was factual. Let's question what she actually got right, very, very little of it. She sat there when Lawrence O'Donnell who is on after her said that maybe President Trump responded to Syria and that the Syrians launched a chemical weapons attack to distract away from the Russia issue. I mean, that's a pretty serious conspiratorial charge to make. And this is all about the double standard, right? Conservative media, conservatives are never allowed to ask the questions. Whenever they get a question at the White House press briefing or during a press conference they are berated by the press as not real journalists capable of asking questions. But Rachel Maddow can moderate a debate. It's a double standard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The thing is, you know -- yes. And, Juan, you know, at Fox we have our commentators and we have -- but we label everything. When you go to the Fox News fridge, you know what you are getting, do you know what I mean? You have your straight vodka and then have you your vodka and soda.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: What are you, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what I am. I'm kumquat juice.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, how that pop into your head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are a sick man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: You got to squeeze a lot of kumquats to get juice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's kind of tart. I would say generally, you know, we've had people who have opinions as debate moderators. But I think this is sort of egregious, and I'll tell you why. I think we try to abide here at Fox that there is a line between people who are opinion --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- and people who are news. Some people criticize. But look, I've seen this line, and I think the public is best served when it's not blurred. I've seen it here. I have seen it at the Washington Post. At the Washington Post I was both reporter and an editorial writer. And when I was a reporter the editorial people didn't tell me what to do. And when I was an editorial writer I never even talked to the journalists.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, it seems to me as someone who has done a debate for Fox, it would -- I can't believe that MSNBC is doing this and I think to pick up on what you were saying, I'm surprised that the Democratic Party isn't saying hey, we don't like it because it then opens the door to conservatives doing the same thing down the line.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. And that opens the door for Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's probably --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what Hannity said by the way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's true. Diamond and Silk and Watters. There you go.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: My God --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's probably in contract though to moderate these debates and NBC didn't want to cause any problems with their biggest political star. They have enough problems. They are getting sued for a quarter of a billion dollars by the Covington boys. They spiked that Weinstein expose. You know, things didn't work out with Megyn Kelly. It didn't work out with Brian Williams, it didn't work out with Matt Lauer so there is a lot of problems over there. They don't need this. They have a lot invested in Rachel but her brand has suffered because she lied for two years. And so, they need to realign her brand with the NBC News division to resuscitate her credibility now because even the New York Times reporters aren't allowed on her show because she's too fringe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But what do you make all of this Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Well, I look at this and I think, if I'm an independent or Democrat voter and I'm looking at this field, I wouldn't hear from them. And I want to hear how they take each other on, how they present their ideas and if they can do something other than attack the President, which Rachel Maddow can't do that. And so the biggest worry for voters like that if she's going to insert herself too much into the debates, when really these stages both of them are going to be incredibly crowded, and you have to be very precise and how you extract information and the questions you ask, so the candidates have to think. And Lord knows that - I don't know that she's capable of asking a really tough follow-up question. And you sold Charlemagne and Elizabeth Warren, it takes one follow-up question to completely trip up a candidate, and I think it's really important when you've got such a crowded field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And they're not going to - and she's not going to ask questions that the - that will pull anybody to the middle. It'll just be how liberal can you get or less--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Which candidates does she like best, is she going to go easier on them, and that's also a disservice to people watching.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I actually don't mind her asking the questions, I mind that there's a double standard about who gets to ask the questions. I think that people are capable of reporting and also having opinions, but this idea that only the Left is allowed and the Far-Left is allowed to ask the questions legitimately, that's where it gets ridiculous. Like if Rachel Maddow is capable of asking questions, so is Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is she going to ask Liz Warren about her fake Indian heritage?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Probably not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I probably don't think so. And she's had Liz Warren on her show about three times, I think, more than any other Democrat Presidential candidate. She's been on Rachel Maddow Show a lot, so it's pretty clear you know there's a rooting interest there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is an outrage. By the way, I'll - Bill Maher is a smart guy. How can you believe that a President would say I'm not leaving? I mean, that is like the most insidious thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But, Greg, didn't Trump say in the course of the last leg of 2016 that he would - he's not going to necessarily abide by the results?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, and it was Hillary that didn't abide by the results.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She still thinks she--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: This is way Bill Maher has lost it. He used to be funny. He used to be relevant, but he's acting as though the President has already been defeated. We haven't had the election yet and we have a lot of run-up between now and then, so stop acting like he's barricaded himself inside the Oval Office with a water pistol and Michael Cohen's carcass.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. U.S. women's national soccer team being attacked for trouncing Thailand in their World Cup opener, the controversy next.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, if you're sick of winning don't rewatch the U.S. women's national soccer team's first game in the World Cup yesterday. The U.S. powerhouse team crushing Thailand 13 to 0, critics quick to pounce on the win, saying the team running up the score and excessively celebrating their goals was "Disrespectful and disgraceful". But Head Coach Jill Ellis is defending her team.

utterances.speaker: JILL ELLIS, U.S. WOMEN'S NATIONAL SOCCER COACH
utterances.sentences: This is a World Championship so every team that's here has been fantastic to get to this point. And I think that to be respectful to opponents is to play hard against opponents, and it is as Sir Alex said, it's a tournament where gold differential is a criteria.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Why do you hate the score run-up from yesterday?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We watched it happening--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, it's an interesting fun fact. They scored more goals in one game than a typical men's team scores in an entire season. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As I made it up. This is also what shut up about politics moment. I actually don't mind sports - I just hate it when politics and Megan Rapinoe, as you know, is somebody that - I guess, I don't know, kind of like - she was part of the whole kneeling and stuff. And whenever - I just keep that away. But I will tell you this, what's worse than all of this, is pretending you know why they scored so many goals, because it has to do with - what? What does that have to do with?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Differential.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Differential.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So yesterday Dana was sitting here - Dana was sitting here and she didn't know why they scored all those goals. So she asked Allison (ph), our Floor Director, why do they score all those goals? And you said, "Oh, it's because of the different--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Differential.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Differential. And then Dana went on Twitter and there was somebody like, "Why they are scoring" - she goes, it's because of the differential. And then she had a little emoji of something like this. And it's like, you just stole that information from our Floor Director--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She is not even here to defend her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know - I didn't know she was off today. I wrote three pages of notes condemning Dana's behavior.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can use those another time.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We may all get trophies when were five years old, but the World Cup, only one team gets the trophy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You're a competitor, you're an athlete, how do you feel about them running up the score?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Well, I also love the United States of America and I think the U.S. Women's National Team is phenomenal and it just goes to show when they celebrate every goal, how much they want this, and how important it is to them and how they work for this their entire lives and their careers. From the time they start playing in early adolescence or childhood, all the way through college, and if they're lucky they get on successive World Cup teams. Alex Morgan had five goals yesterday and three assists. They did so beautifully and it means something to them. And for them to celebrate as Americans, we should be high-fiving along with them. And of course I feel bad for the Thai women's team. This is their first time in World Cup play. And yet it feels horrible to get shutout. It always does. But I also thought that the U.S. woman were very gracious to their competitors after the game.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I agree with the coach, I mean, this is the big leagues.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: This is you got a win and you got to win hard and you got to win early and I actually don't feel so bad. It'll mean make the Thai team better--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: --and better team--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Because now they'll not want to get shut out again, so they'll go back and practice and be a better team.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And they still have two more games to play at least.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's just a big deal because usually games are like won nothing, that's why people care about this. It was just an eyebrow raising event. In tennis if someone beats you 6-Love, 6-Love, two sets in girls tennis, no one cares. If someone wins--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Why don't you care about girls tennis, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sexist.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I defended Serena Williams on this show dammit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can't keep bringing out that card.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I will play if I had to Gutfeld. And in football, if you're up 54- 12 and you just run the ball. You don't throw it deep, so there's ways to do it. I understand about excessive celebration, maybe on the 11th or the 12th goal--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, maybe you don't have to slide around and do a dance, I get that. But it's like black flipping when you're up 13 nothing in baseball, you don't need that. But you know what, let them have their win and I'm proud of them.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, Juan, there have been questions from some of the teammates asking, "Would you tell a men's soccer team not to celebrate too hard?"

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think you would. I mean. I think that you know like we have the NBA playoffs going on right now and you can see that at some games, in fact, at the end, if one team is up the other team would if dribble the ball out. Just - I mean, it's not like you're going to and just run up the score for no reason. There is a real legitimate reason why the U.S. women's team did this, as Greg was pointing out, because of goal differential. Down the line, if there's any kind of tie, the U.S. wants to move ahead. I can understand that. The question in my mind was, is there a mercy rule? Is there some way that people could act in way--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They should have a mercy rule on this show, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, then you would be out.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: You know what, the men's team had the mercy rule when they didn't show up in the World Cup. But the mercy didn't make the World Cup last--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You mean our team - but I mean, no - I mean, let's not be critical.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So let the women celebrate and if they are that fantastic than they can celebrate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know, but I think this is not - I think a lot of people, especially for kids, because - like, my granddaughter's already have the jerseys for the U.S. women's team. I think a lot of kids were like, "Well, why they keep beating up on these other girls?", not understanding.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Because you got to win the game people. Anyway. Up next a high school principal suspended after being accused of plagiarizing Ashton Kutcher - yes, the actor, the details up next.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: A West Virginia principal now finding himself on the other side of disciplinary action. Parkersburg high School Principal Kenny DeMoss is accused of plagiarizing a 2013 Teen Choice Awards speech given by actor Ashton Kutcher, in an address he gave to the graduating class in May. And he has now been suspended for 5 days - look for yourself, watch this.

utterances.speaker: KENNY DEMOSS, PRINCIPAL, PARKERSBURG HIGH SCHOOL
utterances.sentences: The first thing is about opportunity, the second thing is about being intriguing and the third thing is about living life.

utterances.speaker: ASHTON KUTCHER, AMERICAN ACTOR
utterances.sentences: The first thing is about opportunity, the second thing is about being sexy and the third thing is about living life.

utterances.speaker: DEMOSS
utterances.sentences: Never had a job in my life that I was better than, that I was too good for. I was always lucky to just have a job.

utterances.speaker: KUTCHER
utterances.sentences: I've never had a job in my life that I was better than, I was always just lucky to have a job.

utterances.speaker: DEMOSS
utterances.sentences: And every job I had was a stepping stone to my next job and I never quit my job until I had my next job.

utterances.speaker: KUTCHER
utterances.sentences: And every job I had was a stepping stone to my next job and I never quit my job until I had my next job.

utterances.speaker: DEMOSS
utterances.sentences: And so opportunities for me look like hard work.

utterances.speaker: KUTCHER
utterances.sentences: And so opportunities looked a lot like work.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: It's so weird. DeMoss has apologized saying, in hindsight, he wished he cited his sources more. Jesse, I think this is pretty fantastic that he was so inspired by Ashton Kutcher six years ago then he internalized that speech and he just - all he forgot was the citation. He said that even steal anything. He was just inspired by the format.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Biden just hired this principal as a speechwriter. But if you're going to plagiarize the speech, that's a good one to plagiarize. I really liked the message that Ashton shared. But you know if you're going to plagiarize, the worst person to do it would be a principal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's not really the role to do that. Do it as a politician instead.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Juan, kids getting so much trouble for plagiarizing.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You fail.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And in college you have to digitally turn in all of your papers that compare every paper to every other paper to make sure that you are not lifting passages. But he didn't just live to passage or two, that was - that was the whole. That was a massive cut and paste job.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. So principals are role models, I don't think there is any question for a lot of the people - or young people in their schools, and so they have to live up to a higher standard. And his standard - and even the excuse Kennedy, was just lame.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Format.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, My Gosh, format. He was word-for-word as you can see in that, right, so I think, that was pretty horrific. And five days? I think that he should be punished in more significant fashion.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Are you saying lock him up, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Lock him up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but I think, maybe he should have to like sit and listen to a Trump rallies. Trump as goes off the cuff.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: You know what, he is in West Virginia I'm sure he probably has- -

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: --real punish, it will be Hillary Clinton's speech. Graduation that she did the other day--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You don't like her.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, that was torture. Kids these days, they're always fact- checking you in real-time. This is brought to his attention and to the attention of everybody else by a student who was graduating, who was listening and went, "Oh this sounds a lot like Ashton cooker - Kutcher". Google, Google, Google, "Oh, yes it's the same thing". So, look, he's a principal, looks really bad.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes, 18-year-olds have good memories--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And should remember that moment when she will was 12 like, Ashton Kutcher is so dreamy, and I just love his message and what he has to say. Wait a second, that's too familiar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You got - you know, I bet Ashton Kutcher never thought he would ever be plagiarized for a speech. Right that's like copying the test from a court - high school quarterback. It's just something you're not going to do. But he's actually surprisingly intelligent. I guess, my - I wonder why he did it. I think he probably waited till the last minute to write his speech and he freaked out and realized it was harder than he thought, and so he decided to like, look - he looked around for - he looked. You what he did, he Googled great commencement speeches and then he gotten into that. Well, you know maybe if I just put him - and next time just quote people. Do like 10 inspirational quotes from Greg Gutfeld's book, the Gutfeld Monologues. It's on paperback.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Did he leave out the sexy part?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He changed that part, which technically then isn't plagiarism.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How happy would you be as a student for your principal to get in trouble?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, especially if--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: --if you are fat kid and if he suspended you and then he goes down--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sweet.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I think that we should do some reporting and find out how the student body actually feels about that this principal, because if he's one of those principals that hides out at McDonald's and gives you a detention slips if you leave campus and go there for lunch. Then you're probably pretty happy. But if he's everyone's best friend and--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Then you're going to feel bad.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I already feel bad.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I don't feel bad at all. I think fantastic. "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back, time now for a "One More Thing". Gregory?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, it's time for--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Animals are Great!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, let's check out this animal right here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's Jesse Watters new office chair. Now I'm going to tell you a story. We all had to move offices. We all had to get - we all got the same chair, right, which kind of like just a normal chair. But that wasn't good enough for Jesse. So he went to Levitz or Raymour & Flanigan and said, "What kind of chair did executives use in the 1980s? Are there any chairs left over from Wall Street that I could use?" So they ordered the leather exec 3,000 and that is your chair. It's almost modeled after your chair. Look at the flow - how it goes up like that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes. It's tufted and studded. It's got the Winchester stuffed. It's perfect.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Is it "Animals are Great", because there are so many cows have to die?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's cruel, cruel chair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's so comfortable and it swivels and the other one wasn't working for back.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Are you crying - you're laughing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Would you have one more photo before we move on? I think this is my favorite photo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is me in your chair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, went in my chair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Johnny (ph)? I will lock my office next time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Jesse go for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I need to return that chair. I don't know where you've been.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh bad place.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Remember this guy - what's his name James Holzhauer. He won - I think it was $2.4 million on a 33 game Jeopardy! streak. Well, he won about 2.4 million and Uncle Sam took half of it. But here's the breakdown. The feds took about $860,000, California took $280,000 of his winnings. And so like if they hadn't filmed this show in maybe Nevada he would have only been taxed about $860,000. So California kills people, kills success. All game shows should be filmed in low tax states like Nevada. And should I boycott California?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think so.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: --boycott for one week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And I congratulate you on your four day boycott of the Dominican Republic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I still have not gone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you've still not gone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: --Martha not boycotting that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Take a seat, take a seat. All right. You know how difficult it is to be a first responder? Well, take a look at this video. Yes, that big truck that crashed near Bozeman, Montana yesterday had 133 million bees onboard. Some of the first responders from the Hyalite fire department and the Gallatin County Sheriff's Office had to put on fire gear to avoid being stung before others came in to clean up the mess. The bees were on their way from California to North Dakota. The crash left the truck leaking diesel fuel, but that's not all. The first responders also had to deal with honey leaking across the highway. No one was hurt, that's good news. And only 3,000 of the more than a 100 million bees were lost. Isn't that honey of a story?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: How did they get them back?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sticky situation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would say so. Very good, very good. OK. Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, the best thing to do during the summer for young people who want to make money is to have a lemonade stand. But all across the country these busy bodies and no-goodniks think they're doing everyone a favor by calling the police on poor kids who are budding capitalist, but not in Texas. Greg Abbott, the Governor there just signed the law that allows kids to have lemonade stand without licenses. Finally, hopefully, this is a trend that will catch on in other states, because it's a great way for kids to hydrate their neighbors and to make a quick buck, so they can buy the stuff they want.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that would also legalize beer delivery.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. Katie, you're up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not for kids.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: --- but the adults manning the lemonade stand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK. So this morning the Council for Citizens against Government Waste released their 2019 Congressional Pig Book which is all about government waste and fraud and abuse. And this year they brought along a special guest to really drive the point home. A live pig named Faye, the pig. There she as a human pigs. And look how cure their outfit is. This year they exposed 282 earmarks with the cost of $15.3 billion which is a 4 percent increase from 2018, so more cutting and less spending. But Faye, the pig, looks pretty happy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Boy I tell you.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They're cute.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Set your DVRs, never miss an episode of “The Five.” "Special Report," it's up next with Bret Baier. Hey Bret, how are you?
